ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Primary source research, constructive writing
Senior research
I learned about planning a longer thesis. Exposure to archival research. Had the chance to develop a structure for the senior thesis.

I learned how to approach an independent research project in history, from applying for grant applications, to performing archival research, to self-motivating to write and analyze documents in a way that I had not before.

It was really helpful for me to have regular assignments for me to check in about. A lot of my friends in other majors didn't have any assignments or guidance so I appreciated having work more broken up for me.
How to develop, research, and begin writing my senior project. Since this isn't a class that meets every week, I was really pushed to manage my own time and keep myself accountable.
to synthesize different research sources and media in preparation for writing a thesis
Research, writing
NA

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Depends on your advisor, but Prof ODonnell is amazing. Periodt.
senior research
No weaknesses of note. The program provides a good structural framework to keep students on course for completion of the thesis.
I think the incremental deadlines are helpful to stay on track and the meeting with Melissa Grafe was extremely helpful as a first step in the research process.
There is no formal day-by-day structure, which ends up forcing you to set your own schedule, block out time, and create your own deadlines.
great mentorship and guidance with library resources
Great course!
maybe more accountability, it was hard for me to keep accountability in the course (weakness)

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Sure. Its required.
Though it is a required course, were it optional, I would still recommend it. It is useful preparation for anyone contemplating graduate work.
Yes, a yearlong thesis seems like a much more enriching experience and manageable project that a semester one.
yes! hshm thesis is super rewarding
Yes, for the HSHM major
